en.pressContinue: Press the next button to continue.
en.tutorialTxt_1: The atomic number of an element is equal to the number of protons it contains
en.tutorialTxt_2: The atomic mass of an element is the sum of the protons and neutrons it contains
en.tutorialTxt_3: In a neutral atom, the number of electrons is equal to the number of protons
en.game_s_1_1: Hello! You have to throw particles to ATOM
en.game_s_1_2: Protons, electrons and neutrons make a ATOM
en.game_s_1_3: Protons give a name of the atom
en.game_s_1_4: Try to copy element in your right to your left
en.game_s_2_1: The tool we will use first is the THERMOMETER
en.game_s_2_2: Each type of cloud appears at a certain height. Once we find it I will take notes about its altitude. This helps to understand what kind of cloud we are analyzing.
en.game_s_2_3: Sorry! I forgot to tell you that we will use BINOCULARS to find clouds.
en.game_s_2_4: Once we find them I will take notes about some curiosities in my notebook.
en.game_s_2_5: Once we find them I will take notes about some curiosities in my notebook.
